definition: to rain/(of rain, snow etc) to fall/to precipitate/to wet

sentences.english: A broken wood bridge, looked like was damaged by the thunderstorm.
sentences.chinese: 一個斷裂的木橋，看上去象是被暴風雨沖垮的。

sentences.english: There's a storm coming, so let's sheet in the sail.
sentences.chinese: 暴風雨要來了，咱們收帆吧。

sentences.english: Its crew consisted of themselves and a boy to assist---truly a poor equipment with which to face a great and stormy ocean like the Pacific.
sentences.chinese: 這隻裝備簡陋的小船，就要駛向太平洋的暴風雨了。

sentences.english: The soldiers laboured their way in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 士兵們在暴風雨中喫力地前進。

sentences.english: The old building fell down in the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那棟舊樓在暴風雨中倒塌了。

sentences.english: Many trees were overthrown by the storm.
sentences.chinese: 許多樹被暴風雨刮倒了。

sentences.english: The clouds warned that a storm was coming.
sentences.chinese: 烏雲預示着將有暴風雨來臨。

sentences.english: The ship was at the mercy of the storm.
sentences.chinese: 那隻船在暴風雨中失去控制。

sentences.english: The latest round of storms also battered Zhengzhou, capital of Henan Province.
sentences.chinese: 最新一輪的暴風雨還襲擊了河南省會鄭州。

sentences.english: Sometimes the air masses which meet at a front cause storms.
sentences.chinese: 有時在鋒面相遇的氣團會造成暴風雨。

sentences.english: The ship's timbers groaned audibly during the storm.
sentences.chinese: 船骨在暴風雨中吱嘎作響。

sentences.english: A storm system is barrelling in.
Those black clouds betoken a storm.
sentences.chinese: 那些黑雲預示著暴風雨即將來臨。

sentences.english: In the storm, many seamen wished they were on shore.
sentences.chinese: 在暴風雨中，許多海員想，要是他們在陸地上就好了。

sentences.english: This picture was taken during a sleet and rainstorm.
sentences.chinese: 這張圖是在冰雨和暴風雨天氣下拍攝的。

sentences.english: Several chimneys blew down during the storm.
sentences.chinese: 有幾個煙囪在暴風雨中颳倒了。

definition: storm/violent commotion/fig. crisis (e.g. revolution, uprising, financial crisis etc)
howling wind and torrential rain (idiom)/(fig.) difficult, dangerous situation
a downpour/rain bucketing down/fig. to be overwhelmed (with work or things to study)
lit. to drop from the sky (idiom)/fig. to appear unexpectedly/to arise abruptly/out of the blue/to drop into one's lap
to arise abruptly/to arrive suddenly/happening suddenly
shaking one to the core/extremely disturbing/hair-raising (idiom)
lit. breeze is still, waves are quiet (idiom); tranquil environment/all is quiet/a dead calm (at sea)
